reviewText: Sweet Sweet Spirit was written by Doris Ackers, whose presence has been on the Friends concerts.  This gathering in Jesus name, Bill Gaithers said there is always a sweet sweet spirit.  Some Gaither concerts truly stand out, and this is one.If you are looking for the old timers, many who have left, check this one that includes the Goodmans, Rex Nelon, J.D. Sumner, Jake Hess, Hovie Lister, Jack Toney, George Younce,  Jessy Dixon, Bob Cain, Janet Pascal, The Easters, Anthony Burger, Ivan Parker, Lily Knauls, Speer Family with Brock Speer, and many more from the early days.  Seems the taping was 1999, and there is a tribute mention to Brock Speer who died in 1999.I enjoy many of the songs like .. (He Set Me Free); (On the Battlefield); (This Great Caravan Keeps Rolling Along); (He's a Personal Savior); (Stepping in the Light).I don't see Lillie Knauls sing often, but she did a beautiful song called (Only a Look) and Jessy Dixon sang (Yes, Lord Yes).  A few other songs that stand out are  (The Love of God); (Lead Me Home Gently); and of course, one of my favorites, (Leaning on the Arms of God).Often we do not hear Anthony Burger sing,  but he joins in a trio with Ivan Parker and Kirk Talley, a nice one called (Glory Road).The old timers quartet features 93 yr old Robert S. Arnold, publisher, composer, singer,  who died at 98 in 2003.  Joining him for an old convention song (I'm Telling the World About His Love) are Jake Hess, Rex Nelon, Ben Speer.Some solos are done by several The Hayes Family (Just Over in the Glory Land);  Gold City (God's Building a Church);  The Ruppes (Angels in the Room);  Reggie Sandler Family (Now That I'm Saved );  The Isaacs  (Reaping in the Spirit);  John Starnes (Let the Hallelujahs Roll) Dan Miller (testimony) sings Joy Comes in the Morning.I enjoyed this one;  so much wonderful music.....Rizzo
summary: Gathering of the old timers;  a sweet sweet spirit!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I now own at least 30 or so videos by Bill Gaither. Love each and every one. Different places,different performers and lots of love. These people not only are wonderful and amazing performers,its always from their soul.They are a family and love each other deeply. They not only perform together,but help each other if needed. All these things contribute to making a wonderful gospel singing family.Boy they have voices that touch every song and your heart. I'am not just buying the Gaithers,but the ones that perform. Like the Hoppers and Jason Crabb, now they are great. I will keep on buying the Gaithers as long as he keeps making them....

reviewText: Wonderful video; highly recommended; vintage Gaither Gospel Series featuring the Homecoming Friends in all their glory. Nobody does it like they do; it just keeps getting better and better. I hope Bill and Gloria can continue to do this till they're 100 years old!

reviewText: I buy the Gaithers' dvd's and cd's for a friend who isn't religious at all, but loves the old hymns.  Any of the shows that feature the "old-timers" hold his attention.  He loves this one, especially.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was searching for a song, - The Love of God. As there are two songs with this title, I wanted to be sure I found the one that I did not have.Joy Gardner, David Phelps, and Guy Penrod are featured in this number. They sing the last verse, and as though that wonderful verse is not enough, these three singers, so full of God's love and having so much talent, make the rafters ring! And the talent and devotion of the other indicated to me a bound of fellowship and love. (I think they were enjoying it as much as I was.) Over and over and over, I play that song. It was delight to discover that I enjoy the whole DVD.  Only one song raised my eyebrows, but others may really like it, so I shall leave that up to them.  Lively and touching songs, most of which I have heard for years, and a few really good ones that I am pleased to hear. I wish they had offered a recording of those three dear people, Guy, David, and Joy, singing the whole song. I think Bill Gaither knows to leave us wanting more. It is a sweet and enjoyable DVD.  Mickey Thorne
Title: N/A

reviewText: This item contains a most glorious song entitled "Glory Road".  It took me months of searching but I finally found the song on this video.  Another disc has this same song by the same trio but it is a later version and not quite so well sung.Kirk Talley is particularly spectacular in this version and I was suprised to find that Anthony Burger could sing so well; of course Ivan Parker is always easy on the ear.I recommend this vintage Homecoming disc to anyone who enjoys good gospel singing.
